titles: The anatomie of abuses contayning a discouerie, or briefe summarie of such notable vices and imperfections, as now raigne in many Christian countreyes of the worlde: but (especiallie) in a verie famous ilande called Ailgna: together, with most fearefull examples of Gods iudgementes, executed vpon the wicked for the same, aswell in Ailgna of late, as in other places, elsewhere. Verie godly, to be read of all true Christians, euerie where: but most needefull, to be regarded in Englande. Made dialogue-wise, by Phillip Stubbes. Seene and allowed, according to order.
author: Stubbes, Phillip.
notes: A second part was published the same year.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: England --  Social life and customs --  16th century --  Early works to 1800.
